subject: Re: [junit] Time Testing
msgSnippet: ... You need to put the JUnitPerf code in a separate test suite.  You ll find an example at: http://clarkware.com/software/JUnitPerf.html#howtouse Does that
messageBody:
On Jan 4, 2005, at 7:32 PM, Harbir Singh Hundal wrote:

> I am testing the webrrowser using Junit, and the test
> is running fine, I am using the elclipse IDE.
> now i was to run a test to check the time and load of
> the test using JunitPerf, and i am new to Junit and
> to JunitPerf, therfore i am finding it a bit tough to
> analyze how t do it.
> do i need to put the JunitPerf code in existing
> TestCase class or do i need to create a new suite.

You need to put the JUnitPerf code in a separate test suite. You'll
find an example at:

http://clarkware.com/software/JUnitPerf.html#howtouse

Does that help?

---
Mike Clark
Clarkware Consulting, Inc.
http://clarkware.com
